```{python}
#| label: military-vs-medical-research-spending
#| fig-width: 12
#| fig-height: 6

import sys
import os
from pathlib import Path

# Add project root to path
project_root = Path.cwd()
if project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health':
    while project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health' and project_root.parent != project_root:
        project_root = project_root.parent
sys.path.insert(0, str(project_root))

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from brain.figures._chart_style import (
    setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines,
    COLOR_BLACK, COLOR_RED, COLOR_BLUE, COLOR_WHITE
)

# Setup brutal neobrutalist styling
setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

# Create figure
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 6))

# Data
categories = ['War on\nHumanity', 'War on Disease']
spending = [2700, 68]  # In billions
colors = [COLOR_RED, COLOR_BLUE]

bars = ax.bar(categories, spending, color=colors)

# Add custom labels
# Label inside large bar
war_spending = spending[0]
ax.text(bars[0].get_x() + bars[0].get_width()/2., war_spending * 0.7,
        f'${war_spending/1000:.1f}T', ha='center', va='center',
        color=COLOR_WHITE, fontsize=72, fontweight='bold')
ax.text(bars[0].get_x() + bars[0].get_width()/2., war_spending * 0.4,
        categories[0], ha='center', va='center',
        color=COLOR_WHITE, fontsize=44, fontweight='bold')

# Label above small bar
cure_spending = spending[1]
ax.text(bars[1].get_x() + bars[1].get_width()/2., cure_spending + (war_spending * 0.025),
        f'${cure_spending}B\n{categories[1]}', ha='center', va='bottom',
        color=COLOR_BLACK, fontsize=44, fontweight='bold', linespacing=1.2)


ax.set_ylim(0, 3000)
ax.axis('off')  # Remove axes - labels are on the bars

# Add watermark
add_watermark(fig)

# Save in brain/figures directory
output_dir = project_root / 'brain' / 'figures'
output_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
plt.savefig(output_dir / 'military-vs-medical-research-spending-comparison.png', dpi=300, bbox_inches='tight', facecolor=COLOR_WHITE)
plt.show()

```
